THE BIBLE FAITHFULL TRANSLATED FOR ALL THE WORLD.

CORRESPONDENCE.

All communications or remittances of money

should be addressed to WILLIAM H. WYCKOFF,

Corresponding Secretary, or C. A. BUCKBEE, As

sistant Treasurer, American Bible Union, 350

Broom Street, New York.

Correspondents should be particular to write,

very legibly their names, Post-Office Address,

County and State.

Periodicals, Minutes of Associations, or State

Conventions, or other records of public, religious

and benevolent institutions, in all parts of the

world, are especially desired to be addressed,

“Bible Union Reporter, New York.”

$30 makes a Life Member; $100 a Life Director.

American Bible Union Rooms,

350 BROOME STREET.

New York March 11th, 1857.

Rev. Isaac Leeser,

Philadelphia, Pa.

My Dear Sir,

At the late meeting of our Board, it was unanimously agreed to allow your claim for $75.00 for reading and cor-recting proofs of three sets of Hebrew plates of Job.

Your letter on the subject does not agree with the earlier letters in which the arrange-ment was made. According to the latter, you would really have no claim for more than $25.00. We sup-pose that you have forgotten the exact forms of expression employed in the earlier letters. But we took this view of the matter. The time was longer than expected, the trouble greater. The work was satisfactorily done, and the compensation is not extravagant.

We enclosed to you a draft for the balance due to you.

Very respectfully,

Wm H. Wyckoff

Cor. Sec.

Just Published.

REVISED ENGLISH SCRIPTURES.

THE BOOK OF JOB

Has been thoroughly revised by the American Bible Union, and is now ready for general circulation. It is published in a variety of forms, to meet the tastes of all classes of readers.

I.

QUARTO EDITION—Contains, 1. The Common English Version, the Hebrew Text, and the Revised Version, with Critical and Philological Notes. 2. The Revised Version, with Explanatory Notes for the English Reader. 3. The Revised Version by itself. This is a very large quarto Volume, printed on choice paper, and bound in muslin. It contains over 300 pages. Price, sent by Mail, $1 50.

II.

OCTAVO EDITION—Contains the Revised Version in Paragraphs, with Marginal Readings, for the English Reader. It contains 69 pages. Price, sent by mail, in paper cover, 35c.; in muslin, 50c.

III.

DUODECIMO EDITION—Is printed on a smaller page than the Octavo Edition. It contains over 100 pages, and will be sent for the same prices of the Octavo Edition. Paper cover, 35c.; muslin, 50c.

IV.

HEBREW AND ENGLISH—This edition is an 18mo. Volume. It contains the Revised Version in Paragraphs, and the Original Hebrew Text, with various Readings, on opposite pages. Over 200 pages. Sent by Mail, bound in muslin, 75c.

V.

HEBREW—One Volume, 32mo. 146 pages. The Original Hebrew Text, with various Readings, critically edited for the American Bible Union Price, by Mail, bound in muslin, 50c.
